DOCNAME: CASE OF MILLER v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was born in DATE and he resides in GPE - on - Tees , Mr PERSON was born in DATE and he resides in GPE and Mr PERSON was born in DATE and he resides in GPE . They are represented before the ORG by Mr Blades , a lawyer practising in ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant was a soldier and the second applicant was a non - commissioned officer in the regular forces of ORG . On DATE they were charged along with CARDINAL others ( pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Army Act DATE ) with CARDINAL counts of indecent assault contrary to section CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE .

CARDINAL . The convening officer , by order dated DATE , convened a general court - martial to try them . On DATE the first applicant was found guilty on CARDINAL of the charges and was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and to be dismissed with disgrace . The second applicant was found guilty on CARDINAL of the charges and sentenced to DATE imprisonment , to be dismissed from the service with disgrace and to be reduced to the ranks . On DATE the confirming officer reduced the first applicant 's sentence to DATE imprisonment and the second applicant 's sentence to DATE and DATE imprisonment , but otherwise the findings of the court - martial were confirmed .

CARDINAL . The applicants petitioned ORG against conviction and sentence . By letters dated DATE and DATE , their representatives were informed of the decisions ( taken by ORG ) to reject their petitions .

CARDINAL . Both applicants applied to the single judge of ORG ( “ ORG ” ) for leave to appeal to that court against conviction and sentence . The first applicant pointed to various alleged failings by the judge advocate during the court - martial and argued that his sentence was excessive . The single judge granted leave to appeal to the full ORG . Before the full ORG , the first applicant added a new ground of appeal ( that he did not have a fair trial by an independent and impartial tribunal within the meaning of LAW , citing PERSON GPE , judgment of DATE , Reports of Judgments and ORG ) . The second applicant argued before the single judge that the judge advocate had erred and misdirected the court and that he had been denied a fair hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal ( referring also to the PERSON judgment ) . The single judge granted leave to appeal to the full ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , a soldier of the regular forces of ORG , was charged ( pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Army Act DATE ) with wounding with intent contrary to section CARDINAL of the Offences Against LAW DATE and with inflicting grievous bodily harm contrary to section CARDINAL of that Act .

CARDINAL . The convening officer , by order dated CARDINAL DATE , convened a general court - martial . On DATE the applicant was found guilty on the first charge and of assault occasioning actual bodily harm contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and to be discharged from the army .

CARDINAL . His petition against sentence to the confirming officer was rejected and his conviction and sentence were promulgated on DATE . By letter dated DATE , his legal representatives were informed that his petition against sentence had been rejected by a Reviewing ORG appointed by ORG . By letter dated DATE , the applicant 's representatives were informed of the decision ( taken by ORG ) to reject his petition against sentence .

CARDINAL . On DATE he presented a further petition to ORG against conviction arguing that he had not had a fair and public hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial tribunal established by law in accordance with LAW ( referring also to the above - cited PERSON judgment ) . By letter dated DATE , he was informed that ORG had decided not to waive the relevant time - limit which had by then expired . It was also indicated in that letter that the “ GPE issue ” had been frequently rejected by ORG and by the ORG .

CARDINAL . His application to the single judge of the ORG was dated DATE and raised the PERSON issue together with the fact that he could not appeal against sentence only to the ORG . On DATE the single judge rejected that application considering that the grounds of appeal were not arguable . He renewed his application for leave to appeal to the full ORG raising the same points .

CARDINAL . NORP In response to these appeals , affidavits were filed on behalf of ORG explaining that neither the presidents nor the members of the applicants ' courts - martial had been under the command of the convening officer and that none had been subordinate to him in the chain of command . Accordingly , the convening officer would not have reported on either the president or the members of the court - martial in their DATE confidential reports . A policy decision had been taken that , as from DATE , all courts - martial would be composed of a president and members who were not in the chain of command of the convening officer .

CARDINAL . The applicants ' appeals were rejected by detailed judgment of CARDINAL DATE . As to the “ GPE point ” , the ORG noted the change in policy as regards the constitution of courts - martial in place since DATE . It considered that there was no chain of command influence and no obvious reason why any observer knowing the constitution of the courts - martial and the full facts would suspect any lack of independence or impartiality . In any event , the ORG pointed out that the applicants ' reliance on the PERSON judgment was misconceived as the only power of the ORG was to enquire as to whether the convictions were unsafe . Where there was abundant evidence to support the conclusion of the courts - martial which had been properly convened in accordance with domestic law , the composition and behaviour of which had not been criticised , the ORG considered that there was no possible reason to intervene . It noted that the time for having regard to the provisions of the Convention had not yet been reached , but it was difficult to see , even in such circumstances , how the provisions of LAW be of any assistance to the applicants .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Army Act DATE which regulated court - martial procedures at the relevant time are set out in the above - cited PERSON judgment ( at § § DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Following the ORG 's report in the PERSON case ( PERSON v. GPE , no . DATE , Commission 's report of DATE ) , it was decided that , as and from DATE , all courts - martial would be composed of presidents and members not in the chain of command of the convening officer . Thereafter , the DATE Act was amended substantially by LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) which came into force on DATE . The new court - martial system for which the DATE Act provides is summarised in the GPE judgment ( at § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) and is outlined in more detail in the case of ORG v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . MONEY , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL ) .
